thread.title: In Bill Belichick era - Patriots: 1 coach; AFC East: 21 coaches | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
thread.title_full: In Bill Belichick era - Patriots: 1 coach; AFC East: 21 coaches | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian | Boston Herald

author: Chris Mason
title: In Bill Belichick era - Patriots: 1 coach; AFC East: 21 coaches | The Blitz | with Jeff Howe & Karen Guregian
text:
This morning the Dolphins fired Joe Philbin and named Dan Campbell interim head coach.
It marked the 21st coaching change in the AFC East since Bill Belichick was named the Patriots head coach on January 28, 2000.
In Bill Belichick's 16th season in Foxboro, he's searching for his 13th AFC East title. The three years his team didn't win it?
In 2000, Belichick was still playing largely with Pete Carroll and Bobby Grier's roster. In 2002 and 2008 his teams finished tied for first place, but lost out on tiebreakers.
With the Patriots running the AFC East, let's take a look at how other teams have fared.
Jets (5)
They have had the fewest coaches, with only five men calling the shots since Belichick arrived.
Al Groh (9-7, .563)
Herman Edwards (39-41, .488)
Eric Mangini (23-25, .479)
Rex Ryan (46-50, .479)
Todd Bowles (3-1, .750)
Dolphins (8)
Dave Wannestedt is the only coach to have a tangible period of success in the Belichick era, but his Dolphins clubs were still overshadowed by Belichick's early teams.
Dave Wannstedt (42-31, .575)
Jim Bates (3-4, .429)
Nick Saban (15-17, .469)
Cam Cameron (1-15, .063)
Tony Sparano (29-32, .475)
Todd Bowles (2-1, .667)
Joe Philbin (24-28, .462)
Dan Campbell (just hired)
Bills (8)
Rex Ryan's second tour of duty in the AFC East has him hoping to become the first Bills coach to have a winning record in the 21st century.
Wade Phillips (8-8, .500)
Gregg Williams (17-31, .354)
Mike Mularkey (14-18, .438)
Dick Jauron (24-33, .421)
Perry Fewell (3-4, .429)
Chan Gailey (16-32, .333)
Doug Marrone (15-17, .469)
Rex Ryan (2-2, .500)
As for Belichick's totals?
Since taking the reigns in Foxboro he's 178-65 with a winning percentage of .733 (and that's just regular season success).
